page.title: 11SHEEP FARMING,BONAR BRIDGE
page.content: In early summer the{sheep}are{clipped. Usually two people work togher. First of all you put the sheep in a pen and you have to take one at a time. You might use eletric or hand shears. You need to cover the ground to keep the wool clean. When the sheep is shorn you roll up the fleece and tie it. Then the sheep is marked and released. You have to{dip}the sheep in a special solution to get rid of flies and ticks. When you dip them you have to push them in the dipper and keep them under the dip for a minute. Sheep have to be dipped twice a year by law. You have to{dose}them just in case they have some infections. When you dose them you have to get a dosing gun and sticks it down their throats and make sure that they swallow the dose.
